16:43 <gdelhumeau> Why I am redirect to "WebHome?editor=wiki" when I click on the "wiki editor" (with a more complete query string)  
16:44 <gdelhumeau> it seems to be done on purpose but it makes me impossible to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6929  
16:45 <gdelhumeau> apparently it redirects me using a "POST" method  
16:45 <gdelhumeau> which makes the parameters invisible from the location bar  
16:48 <gdelhumeau> mflorea, Enygma`, any idea?  
16:51 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: that's normal, we want to preserve the content when switching between Wiki and Wysiwyg edit modes, so we do a submit (POST). You cannot really put the content in the query string  
16:52 <gdelhumeau> ok  
16:52 <gdelhumeau> so what is missing is the need to preserve others parameters, isn't it?  
16:52 <mflorea> why do you say it prevents you from preserve the URL parameters? you could put them in hidden inputs so that they are submitted with the content  
16:55 <mflorea> but they should have lower priority than the form field. Imagine that you have title=foo in the query string. You need to be able to "overwrite" it from the form. If the user changes  the title and then switches the edit mode then he should see the changed title, not "foo"

20:43 <barretto> has joined #xwiki  
21:16 <barretto> Hello guys, I would like to know what would you recommend me to use in order to generate references (like citations in a scientific paper) in an object of a given class. My class has a couple of textAreas in which I would like to allow end-user to cite papers/books/etc. Then in another textArea  
21:16 <barretto>  I would like to generate a list of those cited references.  
21:17 <barretto> I have tried some extensions like Citation, Annotation and Footnotes, but found some drawbacks for each one of them.  
21:17 <barretto> 1. Citation seems a good choice but forces end-user to add a citation object first, before being able to cite it.  
21:17 <barretto> 2. Annotation looks promising if we consider that for the end-user it is easy to create an annotation and fill in the reference data, but it allows multiple annotations at the same place (for example, I can add multiple annotations at the same word) and the annotations tab is now merged with the comments tab so it won't really look like a paper references section.  
21:18 <barretto> 3. Footnotes seems really interesting because we can use footnote macro with the reference and it automatically generates a reference-like content at the bottom at the textArea. The main problem is that it generates a footnote for each textArea which contains the footnote macro, even if I place putFootnotes in another textArea at the end of the class (and using macros is not exactly user-friendly for end-users).  
21:18 <barretto> So, the main question is: is there any other extension that I'm missing which might solve my problem straightforward or should I customize one of those?  
22:48 <vmassol> hi barretto  
22:49 <vmassol> sorry it's late here and I'm going to bed  
22:49 <vmassol> what I suggest  
22:49 <vmassol> is that you send all this information and questions on the xwiki users mailing list  
22:49 <vmassol> that's the best way for you to get some feedback/answer on that  
22:49 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists
